soc.game

Class SOCRoutePiece

  • java.lang.Object
    • soc.game.SOCPlayingPiece
      • soc.game.SOCRoutePiece
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SOCRoad, SOCShip

    public abstract class SOCRoutePiece
extends SOCPlayingPiece
    A playing piece that connects settlements and cities and can be part of the Longest Route: A SOCRoad or SOCShip. Those can be distinguished by calling isRoadNotShip() or checking SOCPlayingPiece.getType(), whichever is more convenient.
    Since:
    2.0.00
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • SOCRoutePiece

        protected SOCRoutePiece(SOCPlayer pl,
                        int ptype,
                        int edge,
                        SOCBoard board)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Make a new route piece.
        Parameters:
        pl - player who owns the piece
        ptype - piece type, like SOCPlayingPiece.ROAD or SOCPlayingPiece.SHIP
        edge - piece's edge coordinate
        board - board if known; otherwise will extract from pl
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if pl null, or board null and pl.board also null

    • Method Detail

      • getAdjacentNodes

        public int[] getAdjacentNodes()
        The 2 nodes touching this road or ship.
        Returns:
        the 2 nodes touching this piece, same format as SOCBoard.getAdjacentNodesToEdge_arr(int)

      • isRoadNotShip

        public final boolean isRoadNotShip()
        Is this piece a road on land, and not a ship on water? Convenience method for readability in boolean tests.
        Returns:
        True for roads (pieceType SOCPlayingPiece.ROAD), false otherwise
